item.title: Afghanistan: US under pressure over evacuation deadline
item.description: France, the UK and Germany all raise the possibility of troops staying beyond the end of August.

item.title: Afghanistan: PM to urge G7 leaders to step up support for refugees
item.description: Boris Johnson will also ask the US to delay the withdrawal of its troops, at a virtual meeting of the G7.

item.title: Afghanistan: Person on no-fly list flown to UK during Kabul evacuation
item.description: However they are not deemed a person of interest to security agencies or police after an investigation.

item.title: M25: Three dead and two arrested after crash involving lorry, minibus and car
item.description: A fourth person is in hospital after the crash involving a lorry, minibus and car near Waltham Abbey.

item.title: How losing his sight spurred cyclist Steve Bate to the Paralympics
item.description: Steve Bate was told he could be blind within four years - now he's defending his Paralympic title.

item.title: Record number of migrants cross Channel in a day
item.description: More than 800 people reached the UK on Saturday in 30 small boats, the Home Office confirms.

item.title: Love Island crowns winners on summer return
item.description: The winning couple are named on the latest series of the ITV2 dating show.

item.title: Social care charges: Disabled and vulnerable adults hit by steep rises
item.description: Many are facing a significant rise in the money they have to pay towards the support they receive.

item.title: Climate change: Europe's extreme rains made more likely by humans
item.description: Heavy rainfall that led to deadly floods in Germany and Belgium was influenced by human induced warming.

item.title: Proud Boys leader sentenced for burning Black Lives Matter flag
item.description: Enrique Tarrio admitted to burning a Black Lives Matter flag, stolen from a church, in July.

item.title: US VP Kamala Harris criticises Beijing intimidation in South China Sea
item.description: She is currently on a tour of the region as the US aims to reaffirm its commitment to the region.

item.title: Man arrested as Katie Price taken to hospital
item.description: Police are called to reports of an assault in the early hours of Monday morning.

item.title: Retail bosses demand more protection for UK workers
item.description: Industry leaders are calling on the UK government to follow Scotland’s lead on protecting shop workers.

item.title: The Papers: Kabul airlift deadline amid Taliban 'red line'
item.description: Tuesday's front pages continue to focus on the international evacuation operation from Afghanistan.

item.title: From earrings to tiles – what you can do with plastic waste
item.description: How people around the world are recycling plastic waste themselves and turning it into cool stuff.

item.title: VR helps Indians and Pakistanis visit their lost homes
item.description: Indians and Pakistanis who fled their homes during partition can now revisit their childhood - virtually.

item.title: How the world's oldest hat shop made it through lockdown
item.description: Lock & Co was first established in 1676 and has sold hats to the likes of Nelson and Winston Churchill.

item.title: Mission: Impossible request leads to Hollywood encounter
item.description: A request for an unnamed VIP to land in a garden leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Snowdon: 'This is the worst queuing I can remember'
item.description: A group maintaining the mountain warns of the pressures large numbers of visitors bring.

item.title: 'Toby will be a better person after Love Island'
item.description: Lewis Preston runs the finalist's social media accounts and thinks he'll cope with any negativity.

item.title: London council worker's bus odyssey sparks Twitter storm
item.description: Jo Kibble got from London to Morecambe in a day on public buses - "a great way to see the country".

item.title: The Last Bus: Timothy Spall film gives teen busker big break
item.description: Caitlin Agnew was just 16 when two of her songs were picked to feature on the soundtrack for The Last Bus.

item.title: From broken hip to my first Paralympics
item.description: Paralympic wheelchair basketball player Lucy Robinson wants to inspire others.

item.title: Olympic boxer Ben Whittaker becomes Wolverhampton's mayor for a day
item.description: The silver medallist said in a post-bout interview in Tokyo he wanted to experience the honour.

item.title: Ferrybridge chimney stacks demolished in controlled explosion
item.description: The controlled explosion takes place at a former coal-fired power station in West Yorkshire.

item.title: Kenya holds biggest ever animal census
item.description: All wildlife on land and sea is being counted to help Kenya's conservation plans and tourism.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: A 'different' Games but Paralympians still hope to shine
item.description: The opening ceremony of the Tokyo Paralympics takes place on Tuesday with the Japanese capital still facing Covid-19 challenges.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Retail survivors: The London shops that have been trading for centuries
item.description: Four London retail survivors explain how they are faring after 18 months of unprecedented turmoil.

item.title: How to keep your cool when the office heats up
item.description: Buildings that are too hot are bad for your health and productivity but simple measures can help.

item.title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey wants to target Tory heartlands
item.description: Smashing Tory dominance in the party's traditional areas is Liberal Democrats leader Ed Davey's plan. Can it work?

item.title: What is Extinction Rebellion and what does it want?
item.description: Extinction Rebellion is planning two weeks of protest across London.

item.title: Zambia's president inspires African opposition leaders
item.description: Long-suffering politicians hope to copy Hakainde Hichilema, who was elected at his sixth time attempt.

item.title: Covid returns to top 10 causes of death
item.description: Covid-19 was the ninth biggest cause of death in England in July.

item.title: Wuhan lab leak theory: How Fort Detrick became a centre for Chinese conspiracies
item.description: Apparent Chinese propaganda efforts are spreading ahead of a US report on Covid-19 origins.

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Kamala Harris joins diplomatic charm offensive in South East Asia
item.description: The US vice-president's trip to the region falls in the shadow of a chaotic withdrawal from Afghanistan.

item.title: Sent to Halifax: One town's asylum story
item.description: What life is like for asylum seekers in a Yorkshire town - and what locals think about accepting more.

item.title: Love Island: Is the dating show's honeymoon phase over?
item.description: The ITV show sparked record complaints, so as the latest series ends, is the magic starting to fade?

item.title: Antonio's celebration to remember on record-breaking night for West Ham striker
item.description: Michail Antonio stands out on his own on the list of West Ham's Premier League scorers - so it was fitting he danced with himself.

item.title: Wood out of third Test against India with shoulder injury
item.description: England bowler Mark Wood is out of the third Test against India because of a shoulder injury.

item.title: Clubs want quarantine exemption before releasing players for duty in red-list countries
item.description: Premier League sides are among leading European clubs set to prevent players from going to red-list countries for September's international break.

item.title: Murray beats lucky loser Rubin after Kyrgios withdraws
item.description: Britain's Andy Murray beats American lucky loser Noah Rubin in the Winston-Salem Open first round after his scheduled opponent Nick Kyrgios withdraws.

item.title: 'I am more nervous but I am also excited' - Cox on the challenges of going for gold in two sports
item.description: Double Paralympic gold medallist Kadeena Cox tells BBC Sport that repeating her Rio heroics in Tokyo will be tough.

item.title: Levante 3-3 Real Madrid: Gareth Bale scores as Real Madrid draw with Levante in thriller
item.description: Watch highlights as Real Madrid draw with Levante in a six-goal thriller as Gareth Bale scores his first La Liga goal since 2019.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: Romelu Lukaku 'perfect piece' for Chelsea, says Ian Wright
item.description: Ian Wright says Romelu Lukaku is the 'perfect piece' for Chelsea's team as the Match of the Day 2 pundits discuss his performance in the Blues' 2-0 win at Arsenal.

item.title: Afghanistan: Why can't the UK hold Kabul airport without the US?
item.description: The US and UK have different timetables for the effort to evacuate people from Afghanistan

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: 'Hey world, do you care what happens here?'
item.description: A young woman shares her fears a week after the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan.

item.title: Hours without food or water in Kabul airport 'hell'
item.description: An Afghan man who worked for the British army tells the BBC he and his family cannot get through the crowds.

item.title: Afghanistan: Foreign troops extension 'a clear violation' - Taliban
item.description: A Taliban spokesman says Afghans with passports can leave on commercial flights "at any time".

item.title: Kabul arrivals in the UK: 'We are the lucky ones'
item.description: UK troops are evacuating British nationals and eligible Afghans. Here are some of their stories.

item.title: Afghanistan: People at Kabul airport flee Taliban with just a suitcase
item.description: Afghans waiting at Kabul airport tell the BBC of their pain at fleeing the country they love.

item.title: Afghanistan: Where will refugees go after Taliban takeover?
item.description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from Kabul airport
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet witnesses Afghan men, women and children fleeing the Taliban regime.

item.title: Afghanistan: Trapped Nottingham family reach Dubai
item.description: The family with two young children were helped to escape from Kabul by the children's head teacher.

item.title: C-17: The US military plane carrying Afghans to safety
item.description: A Boeing C-17 safely carried 823 Afghans from Kabul last week, a record number for that plane.

item.title: Afghanistan: The desperate scramble to escape
item.description: The BBC witnesses scenes of chaos and panic as thousands still crowd Kabul's airport.

item.title: Afghan crisis: Russia plans for new era with Taliban rule
item.description: While Western governments raced to get their people out, Russia appears unfazed by the takeover.

item.title: Family of American taken by Taliban beg for return
item.description: Mark Frerichs, 59, one of the last Americans kidnapped by the Taliban, is stuck in Afghanistan.

item.title: How Afghanistan's media is changing under Taliban rule
item.description: The Taliban are currently on a media offensive but does their rhetoric match what’s happening on the ground?

item.title: 'They will kill me': Desperate Afghans seek way out after Taliban takeover
item.description: Many Afghans are desperate to escape after the Taliban takeover. Some fear there is no way out.

item.title: Afghanistan: Tears and applause as UK appeal helps refugees
item.description: People in Chapel-en-le-Frith in the Peak District collected more than 1,000 bags of donations in 48 hours.

item.title: The treacherous road to Kabul's airport
item.description: As thousands try to flee Afghanistan, the main route to the capital's airport has become treacherous.

item.title: Facebook moves to protect Afghan users' accounts amid Taliban takeover
item.description: The tech giant says it wants to reassure people worried about being tracked down by the Taliban.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight Great Britain athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the 'Weirwolf' to a potential swimming star, who are some of the Great Britain athletes hoping to shine at the Tokyo Paralympics?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Ellie Simmonds and John Stubbs to carry GB flag
item.description: Swimmer Ellie Simmonds and archer John Stubbs will carry the GB flag at Tuesday's Tokyo Paralympics opening ceremony.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight global athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the Blade Jumper to the dancing star and the Tik Tok influencer, meet some of the global athletes hoping to make an impact at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for £10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.

item.title: India's living dead: 'They stared at me like I was a ghost'
item.description: If you're dead you can't own land - so if someone obtains your death certificate you could lose everything.

item.title: Peter Karlsson: The painful verdict on Swedish ice hockey player's 1995 killing
item.description: Peter Karlsson was stabbed to death in the street. His killer said he was protecting himself - via the so-called 'gay panic' defence.

item.title: 'How I found out my dad was a best-selling sex writer'
item.description: Sara Faith Alterman was always close to her father. Then she learned he was concealing a secret.
